description: From Latin arbitratus, past participle of arbitrari (“to be a witness, act as umpire”), from arbiter (“umpire”); see arbiter.

verbs.description: arbitrate (third-person singular simple present arbitrates, present participle arbitrating, simple past and past participle arbitrated)

entries.meaning: To make a judgment (on a dispute) as an arbitrator or arbiter
To submit (a dispute) to such judgment
(mathematics, rare) To assign an arbitrary value to, or otherwise determine arbitrarily.
examples: We wish to show f is continuous. Arbitrate epsilon greater than zero...
